document_data.name: Blackstaff
document_data.mainbody: '''''Blackstaff''''' was a spell applied to a [[staff]] or [[quarterstaff]] that enhanced its combat effectiveness, and gave it the ability to ''[[dispel magic]]'' or cause a spellcaster it struck to lose a prepared spell.
document_data.Effects:
When cast, this spell bestowed upon the target non-magical staff, [[polearm]] or club, a ''+4 [[Item enchantment|enchantment]]''.

When the ''blackstaff'' struck a [[magic]]al item or any person, it ''dispelled magic'' and in the case of [[spellcaster]]s, caused them to forget spells they had memorized.

The effects of ''blackstaff'' could not be dispelled and the staff absorbed any [[spell]]s cast directly at it.

None of the effects of the ''blackstaff'' could harm the caster in any way.
document_data.History:
This spell was created by [[Khelben "Blackstaff" Arunsun]] and was part of the reason why his common appellation was ''Blackstaff'', as he carried a [[staff of power]] that had this spell cast on it with [[permanency]]. 

The ''blackstaff'' spell was found in ''[[Laeral's Libram]]'', a spellbook written by the wizard [[Laeral Silverhand]]. Laeral lost the spellbook sometime during her madness induced by the [[Crown of Horns]], and it was not been seen since. Khelben only shared this spell with those he trusted implicitly. 

However, by the {{YearlinkName|1373}}, the spell ''blackstaff'' was known and in use across the Realms.
